Trees could potentially form their own communities, with different species coexisting and communicating with each other.
The movement of trees could lead to the spread of seeds and the growth of new trees in different locations.
Trees could also help in the prevention of wildfires by moving away from areas prone to fires.
The movement of trees could also have a significant impact on the ecosystem, as they would be able to transport nutrients and water over long distances.
Trees could potentially form their own social structures, with some trees acting as leaders and others as followers.
